title: Probability Concept Adaptation
description: An interactive comparison demonstrating how a single probability concept is adapted for seven different audience levels, from early childhood games with colorful ducks to graduate-level MCMC samplers and corporate risk decision tools.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Education
Instructional Design
Probability
Audience Analysis
learningObjectives: Identify how mathematical concepts are adapted for different age groups
Analyze the progression from concrete to abstract representations
Compare instructional approaches across expertise levels
Design audience-appropriate versions of educational concepts

controls.description: Click tabs to switch between the seven audience level views
Click Compare Mode button to enable side-by-side comparison

assumptions: Seven distinct audience levels represent typical educational/professional contexts
limitations: Sketch previews are simplified representations of full MicroSims
Comparison limited to two views at a time
